Archer Militia.description: A type of trained civilian guard called,'tzakones' responsible for protecting settlements, roads and forts.

Byzantine Guard Archers.description: Byzantium Guard Archers are well trained missile troops equipped with composite bow, sword, mail and a shield.

Peasant Archers.description: A peasant archer is armed with a small bow, and a knife. Unreliable, and only moderately effective as archers.

Trebizond Archers.description: Hailing from the edge of the Black Sea, these well trained archers wear padded armour and use a composite bow.

Byzantine Cavalry.description: Versatile lightly armoured medium cavalry, equally able shooting their bows, or fighting with their swords.

Skythikon.description: Asiatic Nomads, who serve the Byzantine Empire as horse archers, wearing little armour and armed with a composite bow.

Vardariotai.description: Disciplined and highly trained, the Vardariotai wear light armour and fire a composite bow from horseback.

Ballista.description: Resembling a giant crossbow, this powerful weapon can fling a javelin to a great range, skewering men with ease.

Bombard.description: Primitive siege-gun forged of bronze or iron, can shoot solid stone or flaming shot. Inaccurate versus units.

Catapult.description: Older style rock-flinging wooden artillery piece. Can throw flaming and normal shots.

Trebuchet.description: Giant rock flinging artillery piece. Capable of flaming and normal shot. Also able to fling diseased cows!

Arquebusiers.description: Fired at close range, this noisy, smokey and lethal weapon causes morale damage as well as physical hurt.

Crossbowmen.description: Slow to reload, but a potent and easy to use missile weapon firing powerful bolts.

Crossbow Militia.description: Crossbow Militia are peasant crossbowmen called up to defend settlements. Very poorly armoured.

Hand Gunners.description: Earliest hand-held firearm unit. Causes more fear than actual damage. These soldiers need to be capable in close combat due to the short range of their weapons.

Norse Archers.description: Armed with a bow, a sword, shield and light armour, Norse archers are weak at shooting, but can stand their ground in melee.

Peasant Archers.description: A peasant archer is armed with a small bow, and a knife. Unreliable, and only moderately effective as archers.

Mounted Crossbowmen.description: Using smaller crossbows than the infantry, these units use their mobility to stay out of trouble while they reload.

Ballista.description: Resembling a giant crossbow, this powerful weapon can fling a javelin to a great range, skewering men with ease.

Bombard.description: Primitive siege-gun forged of bronze or iron, can shoot solid stone or flaming shot. Inaccurate versus units.

Cannon.description: The typical 'cannon'is powerful and good against both units and defences. Capable of firing solid and explosive shots.

Catapult.description: Older style rock-flinging wooden artillery piece. Can throw flaming and normal shots.

Ribault.description: A small multi-barrel wagon mounted cannon. A good defensive tool able to fire in a nine-barrel barrage.

Serpentine.description: Light cannon designed for use against troops rather than walls.

Trebuchet.description: Giant rock flinging artillery piece. Capable of flaming and normal shot. Also able to fling diseased cows!

Archer Militia.description: Armed with a bow and knife these troops are made up of locals who have been organised to defend their town.

Desert Archers.description: Hardy men from the desert, adept with the bow, but lacking the equipment for close combat.

Kurdish Javelinmen.description: Hardy troops who soften the enemy with their javelins, then finish them off with their swords.

Naffatun.description: These men throw deadly pots of flaming Naphtha that can seep through any armour.

Nubian Archers.description: Coming from all over Africa these light troops are equipped with a bow and hand weapon.

Peasant Archers.description: Accustomed to using their bow for hunting, these peasant archers are armed with a small bow and knife.

Sudanese Gunners.description: Hailing from all over Africa these well trained troops are armed with an arquebus.

Desert Cavalry.description: Fast skirmishers with javelins, best used to harass enemy flanks and fend off archers.

Mamluk Archers.description: Bought as slaves, and trained from boyhood, these formidable soldiers excel at archery, but can also hold their own in melee.

Ballista.description: Resembling a giant crossbow, this powerful weapon can fling a javelin to a great range, skewering men with ease.

Bombard.description: Primitive siege-gun forged of bronze or iron, can shoot solid stone or flaming shot. Inaccurate versus units.

Cannon.description: The typical cannon'is powerful and good against both units and defences. Capable of firing solid and explosive shots.

Catapult.description: Older style rock-flinging wooden artillery piece. Can throw flaming and normal shots.

Grand Bombard.description: The Grand Bombard has increased range, damage and accuracy compared to the bombard.

Trebuchet.description: Giant rock flinging artillery piece. Capable of flaming and normal shot. Also able to fling diseased cows!

Archer Militia.description: Archer Militia are peasant archers called up to defend settlements.

Arquebusiers.description: Fired at close range, this noisy, smokey and lethal weapon causes morale damage as well as physical hurt.

Longbowmen.description: Armed with the armour piercing longbow, Longbowmen can also plant stakes in front of them to keep cavalry at bay.

Peasant Archers.description: A peasant archer is armed with a small bow, and a knife. Unreliable, and only moderately effective as archers.

Retinue Longbowmen.description: Well armoured professional soldiers. Confident and deadly.

Sherwood Archers.description: Wielding a longbow made of yew, and able to hide in any terrain these men are excellent at ambushes, and are outstanding marksmen.

Yeoman Archers.description: English freeholders are required by the King to be trained in warfare, Yeoman archers are highly skilled ranged troops.

Demi Lancers.description: Armed with a lance but with less armour these units are mobile and deadly.

English Knights.description: Elite warriors clad in steel plate armour, these men pack an effective charge, while being hard to kill.

Feudal Knights.description: Protected by heavy armour and armed with a lance, these elite warriors crush and ride down their opponents.

General's Bodyguard (Early).description: Well armed and equipped these elite troops have the task of guarding and fighting alongside the army's general.

General's Bodyguard (Late).description: Elite knights hand picked to protect the general.

Knights Hospitaller.description: Well trained and disciplined these knights are amongst the deadliest heavy cavalry in all Christendom.

Knights Templar.description: Elite and some say reckless knights formed to protect Christian pilgrims in the Holy Lands.

Mailed Knights.description: Encased in mail and equipped with lances and swords these early knights are formidable fighting machines.

Merchant Cavalry Militia.description: Poorly trained, but well equipped cavalry who fight with a sword.

Ballista.description: Resembling a giant crossbow, this powerful weapon can fling a javelin to a great range, skewering men with ease.

Bombard.description: Primitive siege-gun forged of bronze or iron, can shoot solid stone or flaming shot. Inaccurate versus units.

Catapult.description: Older style rock-flinging wooden artillery piece. Can throw flaming and normal shots.

Culverin.description: Able to fire solid or exploding shots, the culverin is devastating against enemy walls and lethal against enemy troops!

Mortar.description: A siege weapon capable of firing over walls and plunging shots down on enemies hiding behind said walls.

Ribault.description: A small multi-barrel wagon mounted cannon. A good defensive tool able to fire in a nine-barrel barrage.

Trebuchet.description: Giant rock flinging artillery piece. Capable of flaming and normal shot. Also able to fling diseased cows!

Aventurier.description: Well skilled troops armed with a crossbow and sword and armoured in plate.

Peasant Crossbowmen.description: Peasant crossbowmen are armed with a crossbow, knife and if lucky enough, some armour.

Scots Guard.description: These Scottish troops are elite armoured longbowmen, and form part of the French King's guard'n

French Mounted Archers.description: Professional soldiers equipped with longbows in the English style, and mounted on horses for mobility

Ballista.description: Resembling a giant crossbow, this powerful weapon can fling a javelin to a great range, skewering men with ease.

Bosnian Archers.description: Bosnian archers are lightly armoured, well trained archers with the added protection of a winged shield.

Pavise Crossbow Militia.description: Italian crossbow militia, armoured with mail and a pavise.

Peasant Archers.description: A peasant archer is armed with a small bow, and a knife. Unreliable, and only moderately effective as archers.

Hungarian Nobles.description: Well equipped with light armour and composite bows, these warriors are good horse archers who are also capable in close combat.

Magyar Cavalry.description: These natural horsemen are armed with a composite bow and wear light armour.

Genoese Crossbowmen.description: Superior Italian crossbow unit armoured with brigandine and a pavise.

Genoese Crossbow Militia.description: Superior Italian crossbow garrison unit armoured with brigandine and a pavise.

Hand Gunners.description: Earliest hand-held firearm unit. Causes more fear than actual damage. These soldiers need to be capable in close combat due to the short range of their weapons.

Musketeers.description: The musket is an improved form of firearm. Firing a heavy shot to a good range, it causes fear, and can pierce any armour.

Bombard.description: Primitive siege-gun forged of bronze or iron, can shoot solid stone or flaming shot. Inaccurate versus units.

Carroccio Standard.description: Wagon bearing standard to inspire the army, pushed by elite troops armed with spears and light armour.

Catapult.description: Older style rock-flinging wooden artillery piece. Can throw flaming and normal shots.

Culverin.description: Able to fire solid or exploding shots, the culverin is devastating against enemy walls and lethal against enemy troops!

Grand Bombard.description: The Grand Bombard has increased range, damage and accuracy compared to the bombard.

Monster Ribault.description: 36 cannon barrels mounted on a wagon frame. Deadly short-ranged defensive gun capable of laying down a tremendous barrage.

Ribault.description: A small multi-barrel wagon mounted cannon. A good defensive tool able to fire in a nine-barrel barrage.

Trebuchet.description: Giant rock flinging artillery piece. Capable of flaming and normal shot. Also able to fling diseased cows!

Crossbow Militia.description: Local militia armed with crossbows and some armour, good for ranged combat, but will melt away in melee.

Desert Archers.description: Hardy men from the desert, adept with the bow, but lacking the equipment for close combat.

Hand Gunners.description: Somewhat inaccurate but capable of firing a powerful shot, the noise and smoke from these handguns can demoralise enemy troops.

Peasant Crossbowmen.description: Wearing little to no armour, but armed with a crossbow these peasants can give far superior troops a nasty surprise.

Sudanese Gunners.description: Hailing from all over Africa these well trained troops are armed with an arquebus.

Sudanese Javelinmen.description: Good for weakening units and breaking up formations, but will quickly dissolve if caught in melee.

Camel Gunners.description: Mounted on a camel this unit fires a powerful musket called a jezail'n

Desert Cavalry.description: Fast skirmishers with javelins, best used to harass enemy flanks and fend off archers.

Granadine Crossbow Cavalry.description: These troops combine the crossbow, favoured by Granadine troops, with the Eastern tradition of mobile warfare.

Granadine Jinetes.description: Lightly armoured skirmishers, armed with a javelin, and capable of forming a circle formation providing constant fire against the enemy.

Lithuanian Archers.description: Skilled archery unit lightly armoured but equipped with a large shield. Able to lay stakes at start of battle.

Peasant Archers.description: A peasant archer is armed with a small bow and knife. Not to be relied upon.

Lithuanian Cavalry.description: Fierce East European horse archers. Lightly armoured, but still enjoy a good hand to hand scrap.

Polish Nobles.description: Able to circle in front their enemies and shoot, these excellent troops himage their javelins before engaging in melee.

Strzelcy.description: Strzelcy, meaning shooters in Polish, are light horse troops protected by light armour using a small crossbow.
